intro: Eritrichium arassanicum, commonly known as the Armenian mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, hairy, and have a distinctive heart-shaped form, while its flowers are pale blue to purple in color. Eritrichium arassanicum is often found in open meadows and is adapted to cold, temperate climates.
